Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] loop on a warc file and dumping every record
 doesn't work
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=ZECM0c85Zk1vpY2wNPtbEkxg7eI57oTfGdYmTrGn4-bA
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

Shaul -

I commented on the issue, but to also address here:

In your other message, you mentioned uncompressing a recompressing a 
WARC; is that the case with the WARC giving this error message as well?

That might explain the error; if the WARC is compressed, we expect it to 
use a 'record-at-a-time' (as if each record were compressed separately 
then concatenated) approach. (We could definitely improve the error 
message, and maybe tolerate record-oblivious compression, though the 
record-at-a-time technique is part of the WARC spec.)

Alternatively, if you are experiencing this error with a WARC that has 
not been uncompressed-and-then-recompressed, could you attach an example 
WARC (in as abbreviated form as possible) to the issue, with details of 
how it was created?

- Gordon @ IA
